Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public final class Game
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This program is a partial rebuild of "Shadowverse", a Collectible Card Game. All the images, sounds, cards and mechanics used in this program are originated from this game, which full credit shall be given to their owners.

    This class is the main class of the project (where the main method is located). It is responsible for basic game features, mechanisms and interactions, such as GUI, game initialization and progress management, resource allocations and invocations, etc.

    The game can be played with 2 players(competitive) or 1 player(self vs. self or for testing purposes). If played by 2 players, each player should have control over 1 leader.

    The program initializes by invoking its own private constructor. The main JFrame will not be visible until leaderSelectionPanel() and cardSwitchPanel(Player) finish running. These two methods are responsible for acquiring basic information of the game.

    Upon the end of the game, endGame(Player) will be invoked and a dialog will show up and display the winner. After that, all player interactions will be cut-off, which means no components will respond to player's command any more. However, players are still allowed to check the final moment of the game and check for card details.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Adrian Zhao
    See Also:
    ImageLib, SoundLib, CardLib, EffectLib, Player, Card, Serialized Form

      • EP_COLOR

      • gameAlive

        private boolean gameAlive
        This field represents whether the game is ongoing or finished. Its initial value is true, and it is only to be toggle to false when endGame(Player) is invoked.

        Many listeners check this field's value first before responding to player's commands.

        See Also:
        endGame(Player)

      • selection

        private Game.Selection selection
        Represents the identity/behaviour of the next card clicked. Player should select their target according to this field value.

        When it's value is Game.Selection.ATTACK, it will hold the attacker Follower and attacker Player. They can later be acquired by invoking its Game.Selection.getAttackerPlayer() and Game.Selection.getAttacker()

        When there is no action taking place on the next click, its value will be Game.Selection.PEND

        See Also:
        Game.Selection

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        private Game()
        This constructor is only to be invoked by the main method at the very beginning of the program.

        The game preparation music will be played through SoundLib until the program finishes getting game information from the player, which will happen at the point that the dialog created by cardSwitchPanel(Player) is being disposed and the main frame becomes visible.

    • Method Detail

      • cardSwitchPanel

        private void cardSwitchPanel(Player player)
        This method creates a JDialog that reveals the initial three cards drawn from the deck and offers the specified player a change to change any one of them. Each card is allowed to be switched only once. The original card will be added back to the deck while drawing a new card.Player can also choose not to switch a certain card.

        The method contains a local class SwitchCardButton that combines a JButton object with a Card object. It will be revealed in the dialog as a JButton with its icon set to the card's hand image. When it is left-clicked for the first time, it will perform the card switch action, and then disable itself from further right clicks. The button will show the card's detail whenever it is right-clicked.

        On the completion of the first player's card switch, the method will dispose its dialog and call itself again with the instance of the second player. On the completion of the second player's card switch, the method will dispose its dialog and invoke initialize() for other game initialization tasks (e.g. GUI).

        Parameters:
        player - Current player that is performing the card switch
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Occurs when there is no preset deck for the player's leader

      • cleanField

        private void cleanField()
        This method checks for both players' fields and destroy any card that is no longer alive. It is called every time an effect is processed, as some effects can deal lethal damage to a follower or destroy cards on the field.

        Banishing cards and attack events do not invoke this method, as they have their own settlements on the targets they affect.

      • discardEffect

        private void discardEffect(boolean displayMessage)
        This method discards the effect that is currently processing by EffectLib. It is only invoked when there is no eligible target found to proceed the effect.
        Parameters:
        displayMessage - true: display the effect discard information on the gameGuideText, nothing
        See Also:
        EffectLib

      • displayMessage

        private void displayMessage(java.lang.String message)
        This method updates String content for gameGuideText, which serves as a information display to the players.

        It checks if the current thread is EDT or not. If it is, change is made directly. If it is not, change will be wrapped in SwingUtilities.invokeLater(Runnable) for EDT to execute.

        Parameters:
        message - the message to be displayed

      • endGame

        public void endGame(Player winner)
        This method finalizes the game. It plays the game end music, creates a dialog that shows the game result(the winner of the game) and disables all interactive components from further receiving player's commands by toggling the value of gameAlive(except for right click events, which checks the card details).

        This method should be and only be invoked when the leader's health drops to 0 or below, or activation of some special effects that allow immediate victory.

        GUI-related code are wrapped in SwingUtilities.invokeLater(Runnable) for EDT to execute.

        Parameters:
        winner - the Player who wins the game
        See Also:
        gameAlive

      • endRound

        private void endRound()
        This method is invoked every time the endRoundButton is pressed. It ends the current player's round, changing field values and activate all "When round end" effects. Then Player.endRound() is invoked to finalize round.

        After current player's round finalization, this method will also initialize the next player's round by invoking Player.iniNewRound() and activating all "Fanfare" effects. endGame(Player) will be invoked if there is no card left in the deck and the player that has the drained deck will lose the game.

        All effects are processed through sendEffect(String, Card, Player, Card, Player). updateGUI() will be invoked at the end of the method to refresh the GUI.

        See Also:
        Player.endRound(), Player.iniNewRound()

      • getEvolveCD

        private int getEvolveCD(Player player)
        This method returns the number of rounds left before a player can use evolve points.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player object to be checked
        Returns:
        the number of rounds left before evolve is available

      • handleAttack

        private void handleAttack(Follower target,
                          Player target_player)
        This method handles attack events targeting an opponent's Follower. The source Player and Follower is acquired through selection object.

        The validity of the attack action will be checked first. The attacker Follower must have correct AttackStatus and the target must be targetable. If the action is approved, the "When fight" and "When attack" effects on the attacker will be activated first, and the target's "When fight" effect will also be activated. Then, damage is dealt to both sides according to their current attack value. Special simple effects will be processed after the damage is dealt(drain and bane).

        All effects are processed through sendEffect(String, Card, Player, Card, Player). If any card is destroyed during the attack event, processCardExit(Card, Player, boolean) will be invoked and the method will not execute any code further.

        Parameters:
        target - the Follower object that is going to be attacked
        target_player - the Player object that owns the target Follower
        See Also:
        Game.Selection, AttackStatus

      • handleAttack

        private void handleAttack(Player target_player)
        This method handles attack events targeting the opponent's leader. The source Player and Follower is acquired through selection object.

        The validity of the attack action will be checked first. The attacker Follower must have correct AttackStatus and the opponent leader must be targetable. If the action is approved, the attacker's "When attack" effect will be activated, and the damage will be dealt to the enemy leader. Simple effect "drain" will be processed after the damage is dealt.

        All effects are processed through sendEffect(String, Card, Player, Card, Player). The game will end if the attack causes the leader's health drops below or equal to 0.

        Parameters:
        target_player - the Player object that is going to be attacked
        See Also:
        Game.Selection, AttackStatus

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        This method initializes all GUI components as well as starting the game.

        The main frame is vertically divided into two main sections with a left-to-right ratio of 0.82:0.18. The left section has 4 horizontal panels representing p2's hand, p2's field, p1's field and p1's hand respectively. The right section has 3 horizontal boxes representing p2's status, game guide and p1's status respectively.

        The playerLeaderImage and enemyLeaderImage are clickable as they can be selected as a target for effects and attacks.

        On the completion of the initialization, a random back ground music will be chosen to play through SoundLib, and then the game will formally start from the first player.

      • leaderSelectionPanel

        private void leaderSelectionPanel()
        This method creates a JDialog that provides both players with 7 leaders they can choose to play. In version 1.0, only Forestcraft and Swordcraft are available with preset decks. The first-pick player will go first with 2 EPs, the second-pick player will go second with 3 EPs and an extra card drawn in its first round.

        When the selection is completed, this dialog will be disposed and cardSwitchPanel(Player) will be invoked as the second step of the initialization.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • processCardExit

        public void processCardExit(Card card,
                            Player owner,
                            boolean isBanish)
        This method processes card exit event for on-field cards, whether the card is banished or destroyed.

        For a banished card, it is simply removed from the field and disappeared. Its "Last word" effect will not be triggered and it will not be transferred to the grave.

        For a destroyed card, it is removed from the field and added to the grave. Its "Last word" effect will also be activated.

        Parameters:
        card - Card that needs to exit the field
        owner - owner of the Card
        isBanish - true: banish the card. Otherwise destroy the card.

      • sendEffect

        private void sendEffect(java.lang.String effect,
                        Card card,
                        Player sourcePlayer,
                        Card cardTrigger,
                        Player triggerPlayer)
        This method sends pending effects to EffectLib and receives response from it.

        A neither EffectLib.Response.DONE nor EffectLib.Response.FAIL response received indicates that a specific target is needed to proceed the effect. The target's identity can vary according to what the effect requires. Therefore, this method first checks if there is an eligible target. If there is, selection will be set to that specific target type. If no card matches the requirement, the effect will be disposed.

        Parameters:
        effect - the pending effect's content string
        card - the origin Card of the effect
        sourcePlayer - the origin Player of the effect
        cardTrigger - the Card that triggers the effect
        triggerPlayer - the Player that triggers the effect
        See Also:
        EffectLib, Game.Selection

      • setLabelStyle

        private void setLabelStyle(javax.swing.JComponent component)
        The method sets the default style for all label components (e.g. labels on JButtons and JLabels).

        Default style is font Font.SANS_SERIF, Font.BOLD, size 18 and center alignment

        Parameters:
        component - the component to be formatted

      • setTextStyle

        private void setTextStyle(javax.swing.JTextArea text)
        This method sets the default style for all JTextArea components

        Default style is font Font.SANS_SERIF, Font.BOLD and size 16

        Parameters:
        text - the JTextArea to be formatted

      • showCardDetail

        private void showCardDetail(Card card)
        This method creates a JDialog to show the details of the given Card. It is wrapped in SwingUtilities.invokeLater(Runnable) to make sure it is executed in the EDT.

        For a Follower, its name, cost, leader, trait(if applicable), original attack, original health, simple effects, effects, attack after evolve, health after evolve and buff lists will be displayed.

        For an Amulet, its name, cost, leader, count down(if applicable) and effects will be displayed.

        For a Spell, its name, cost, leader and effects will be displayed.

        Parameters:
        card - the Card object to be displayed
        See Also:
        EffectLib.getEffectDescription(String, Card)

      • updateGUI

        private void updateGUI()
        This method is invoked whenever the players' statuses change. It checks if the current thread is EDT. If so, updateGUIaction() will be invoked directly. Otherwise updateGUIaction() will be wrapped into SwingUtilities.invokeLater(Runnable) for EDT to process.
        See Also:
        updateGUIaction()

      • updateGUIaction

        private void updateGUIaction()
        This method is only to be invoked through updateGUI() to make sure it runs in the EDT. It repaints all panels and updates all labels and text areas on the main frame.
        See Also:
        updateGUI()

      • useEvolvePts

        private void useEvolvePts(Follower follower,
                          Player owner)
        This method is invoked when a click event has been detected on either playerEvolveButton or enemyEvolveButton. It checks first if the evolve action is valid for the given player. If the conditions are met, Follower.evolve() will be called, the Follower object will evolve and its "When evolve" effect will be activated, else the game will display an error message to inform the player.
        Parameters:
        follower - the Follower object to be evolved
        owner - the player which the Follower object belongs to
        See Also:
        Follower.evolve()
